title: Ruth Funk Center for Textile Arts
text:
The Ruth Funk Center for Textile Arts is a museum in <a href="Melbourne%2C%20Florida">Melbourne, Florida</a>, located in <a href="Brevard%20County%2C%20Florida">Brevard County</a>. It is part of <a href="Florida%20Institute%20of%20Technology">Florida Institute of Technology</a> and exhibits textiles, clothing and accessories.
Opened in 2009, the Center features an international collection of historical and contemporary textiles, <a href="embroidery">embroidery</a>, clothing, <a href="lace">lace</a>, <a href="Sampler%20%28needlework%29">samplers</a> and accessories from North America, Europe, Africa, Japan, India and Central Asia. The collection also includes contemporary wearable art and <a href="fiber%20art">fiber art</a>s.
The museum is named after its founding benefactor, Ruth E. Funk, an artist and designer, who donated funds and her collection of international textiles to the museum in 2006.
